title: German Gothic Oktoberfext font
content:
Hi There

Im designing a new logo and found this font in a illustrator file which I got from Shutterstock. Sadly the font is in outlines so I cannot determine the font used. WhatTheFont gave no results, and I tried other font recognition tools to identify it, with no result.  
 So you are my last hope :)  
Images attached below are a screenshot of the Shutterstock file and the relevant font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405152214im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-08-23%20at%2019_3767.03.44.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405152214im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-08-23%20at%2019_4574.22.35.png)
author: gurbstah

comments.content:
Love the minimal Gothic style.  
Wish I had been able to find it -- assuming it is a font rather than logo design.  
Here is a font with some similarity [Guillemet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405152214/http:/fonts.gestalten.com/guillemet.html).  
Don

I can't find your font either, but you may also like **[Hohenzollern](http://web.archive.org/web/20150405152214/http:/www.fontspace.com/cybapee-creations/hohenzollern)**, created by Carl Albert Fahrenwaldt (1864-1941).

Thnx for the reply guys..  
Other fonts are nice to, but still searching for this one.  
When I find it, you'll hear about it!  
Gr G
Looks like I'm late with this, but I just joined and found your question. There is a font named Pirata One that appears to match the Oktoberfest logo you submitted.
